concept.title: Reducing Tire Expenses
concept.shortdesc: Best practices for minimizing tire wear and maximizing tire longevity to reduce operating costs.

section.title: Importance of Tire Maintenance
section.p: Tire costs represent a major component of automobile operating expenses. Regular inspection and prompt repair of small cuts or holes prevents dirt and water infiltration that can cause blisters or sand boils.

section.title: Proper Inflation
section.p: Maintain proper tire inflation to prevent:

ul.li: Rim cutting from excessive sidewall flexing
Increased puncture risk from excessive road surface contact
Running in streetcar tracks or ruts

section.title: Storage and Maintenance
section.p: Protect tires through proper storage and maintenance:

ul.li: Paint wheel rims annually and prevent rust
Jack up idle vehicles to reduce tire load
Store dismounted tires separately in dark, temperature-controlled spaces
Keep tires free from oil, grease, heat, and light exposure
